item.value: Resource management code should check for thread-bound resources, e.g. JDBC Connections or Hibernate Sessions, via {@code getResource}. Such code is normally not supposed to bind resources to threads, as this is the responsibility of transaction managers. A further option is to lazily bind on first use if transaction synchronization is active, for performing transactions that span an arbitrary number of resources.
for performing transactions that span an arbitrary number of resources.
Supports one resource per key without overwriting
To be used by resource management code but not by typical application code
A further option is to lazily bind on first use if transaction synchronization is active, for performing transactions that span an arbitrary number of resources.

Supports one resource per key without overwriting, that is, a resource needs to be removed before a new one can be set for the same key. Supports a list of transaction synchronizations if synchronization is active
but not by typical application code
not for empty ones that result from PROPAGATION_SUPPORTS with no existing backend transaction.
